**Executive Summary**  
The meeting was an opening ceremony for the UNESCO‑sponsored Kalinga Prize for the Popular Understanding of Science.  The event brought together representatives from the awarding body, the donor, international delegates, and the media.  The host, Dr. Emily Chen, steered the proceedings, while Director General Dr. Anil Kumar delivered the keynote address on Bertrand Russell’s legacy.  Ambassador Hans Müller, French radio journalist Claire Dubois, and UNESCO delegates Isabelle Laurent and Dr. Maria Rossi contributed remarks that highlighted the prize’s global reach.  The donor, Pat Knight, was publicly acknowledged and a proposal was made to name a “Kalinga Suite” at the Ashoka Hotel in his honour.  The ceremony concluded with a formal presentation of the award to a laureate (unnamed in the transcript) and a series of thanks to all participants.
